title: Protocols for " Efficient and stable metabarcoding sequencing data using DNBSEQ-G400 sequencer validated by comprehensive community analyses"
title_html: Protocols for " Efficient and stable metabarcoding sequencing data using DNBSEQ-G400 sequencer validated by comprehensive community analyses"

authors.name: Yuehua  Hu
authors.affiliation: CAS Key Laboratory of Tropical Forest Ecology

description:
Sequencing in DNBSEQ-G400 of this study was carried out in BGI-Shenzhen. Amplicons from 1276 soil samples were randomly and equally distributed into 3 DNBSEQ runs for both 2×200 paired-end (PE200) and 400 bases single-end sequencing (SE400). The left libraries of total 1276 samples were repetitively sequenced two more times by SE400 using different DNBSEQ-G400 machines. Three randomly chosen soil samples from each forest plot (ALS268, LJ105 and NBH217) were all amplified 3 times separately as PCR replicates. The corresponding 9 sequencing libraries were sequenced repetitively by 3 DNBSEQ runs.
Sequencing was carried out using the entire lane of the Illumina MiSeq platform in the University of Minnesota Genomic Center. Amplicons of the 1276 forest soil were normalized and pooled randomly in equal molar ratios into 8 parallel sequencing runs on MiSeq platform. Again, three randomly chosen soil samples from each forest plot (ALS268, LJ105 and NBH217) were all amplified 3 times separately as PCR replicates. The corresponding 9 sequencing libraries were sequenced repetitively by 8 MiSeq runs.
